title: Short-Intensive Instructional Design Course for Improving Medical Education Expertise: 4-Component Framework

context.prior_knowledge: Basic medical knowledge and foundational clinical practice experience
context.additional_context: Bridging the gap between theory and practice by focusing on real-world medical challenges; most learners are university-affiliated personnel with intermediate expertise in healthcare, though primarily non-medical citizens.

learning_goals: Learners can systematically analyze diagnostic tasks occurring in real medical settings according to the four-component instructional design (4C/ID) model
Learners can recognize the gap between theory and practice and propose at least three strategies to reduce it
Learners can improve problem-solving skills by at least 20% through interaction with peer learners and instructors using online collaboration tools
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
